page.title: 02Ecology - Natural History
page.content: Birds Rolling fields, with hedges and wooded corners, sloping down to the Gamber stream givea variety of habitats. Flocks of lapwing feed and breed in the lower meadows.Bevies of l2-2O partridge range the upper fields.. With the mild autumn of l984 flocks of field- fares found sufficient feeding without clearing fallen fruits, so leaving a rich food source for later. Groups of up to 3O siskins feed in winter amid the shelter of the stream alders, where they are left. January snows caused 3O-4O collared doves to roost together in holly trees, such numbers had not been observed before implying increased population. By February most birds needed feeding.
